title: publishers weekly best-sellers
text:
Published: Sun, October 11, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
publishers weekly best-sellers 
For the week ending Oct. 4 
HARDCOVER FICTION 
1. “The Murder House,” by Patterson/Ellis (Little, Brown) 
2. “The Girl in the Spider’s Web,” by David Lagercrantz (Knopf) 
3. “Come Rain or Come Shine,” by Jan Karon (Putnam) 
4. “After You,” by Jojo Moyes (Viking/Dorman) 
5. “Make Me,” by Lee Child (Delacorte) 
6. “Go Set a Watchman,” by Harper Lee (Harper) 
7. “The Aeronaut’s Windlass,” by Jim Butcher (Roc) 
8. “The Girl on the Train,” by Paula Hawkins (Riverhead) 
9. “Pretty Girls,” by Karin Slaughter (Morrow) 
10. “X,” by Sue Grafton (Putnam/Wood) 
HARDCOVER NONFICTION 
1. “Killing Reagan,” by O’Reilly/Dugard (Holt) 
2. “The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up,” by Marie Kondo (Ten Speed) 
3. “Big Magic,” by Elizabeth Gilbert (Riverhead) 
4. “Live Love Lead,” by Brian Houston (Hachette/FaithWords) 
5. “Why Not Me?,” By Mindy Kaling (Crown Archetype) 
6. “In This Together,” by Ann Romney (St. Martin’s/Dunne) 
7. “The 20/20 Diet,” by Phil McGraw (Bird Street) 
8. “Furiously Happy,” by Jenny Lawson (Flatiron) 
9. “Between the World and Me,” by Ta-Nehisi Coates (Random/Spiegel & Grau) 
10. “Rising Strong,” by Brene Brown (Random/Spiegel & Grau) 
2015, Tribune Content Agency
